dir.title: Friday the 13th Collection (1980-2009)
dir.summary: The franchise mainly focuses on the fictional character Jason Voorhees, who drowned as a boy at Camp Crystal Lake due to the negligence of the camp staff. Decades later, the lake is rumored to be "cursed" and is the setting for a series of mass murders. Jason is featured in all of the films, as either the killer or the motivation for the killings.

dir.title: Annabelle Collection (2014-2017)
dir.summary: Annabelle is a 2014 American supernatural horror film directed by John R. Leonetti, produced by James Wan, and written by Gary Dauberman. It is both a prequel to and spin-off of The Conjuring and was inspired by a story of a doll named Annabelle told by Ed and Lorraine Warren. The film stars Annabelle Wallis, Ward Horton, and Alfre Woodard. The film was released worldwide on October 3, 2014. A sequel is currently in the works. In October 2015, it was reported that Gary Dauberman would be returning to write the script. On March 22, 2016, Warner Bros. slated the film for release on May 19, 2017.

dir.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street Collection (1984-2010)
dir.summary: A slasher film series revolving around people who are stalked and killed in their dreams by Freddy Krueger.

dir.title: The Godfather Collection (1972-1990)
dir.summary:
Overview
Francis Ford Coppola’s trilogy films about the everyday life of a New York mafia family. With its star-studded cast these films would go down in history as some of the greatest Hollywood has ever produced.

dir.title: The Matrix Collection (1999-2003)
dir.summary:
Overview
The Matrix collection depicts a complex science fiction story incorporating many philosophical elements. Written and directed by the Wachowski brothers and produced by Joel Silver. Number of Movies: 3 Revenue: $1,627,105,295 Genres: Adventure, Action, Thriller, Science Fiction

dir.title: Rambo Collection (1982-2008)
dir.summary:
Overview
Rambo is an action film series based on the David Morrell novel First Blood and starring Sylvester Stallone as John Rambo, a troubled Vietnam War veteran and former Green Beret who is skilled in many aspects of survival, weaponry, hand to hand combat and guerrilla warfare. Number of Movies: 4 Revenue: $727,873,237 Genres: Adventure, Action, Thriller, War

dir.title: Saw Collection (2004-2017)
dir.summary:
Overview
The extremely successful horror film series about a mysterious murderer who gives his victims macabre riddles they must solve to earn their freedom. After a surprise debut film success Saw would be made into a multimedia franchise, spawning 7 installments. Number of Movies: 8 Revenue: $878,307,806 Genres: Horror, Thriller, Crime, Mystery

dir.title: Batman Collection (1989-1997)
dir.summary:
Overview
The Tim Burton and Joel Schumacher tetralogy film series of the DC Comics character Batman.

dir.title: Daddy's Home Collection (2015-2017)
dir.summary:
Overview
The story of a mild-mannered radio executive who strives to become the best stepdad ever to his wife's two children, but complications ensue when their freewheeling, freeloading real father arrives, forcing stepdad to compete for the affection of the kids.

dir.title: John Wick Collection (2014-2019)
dir.summary:
Overview
John Wick is a 2014 American neo-noir action thriller film directed by Chad Stahelski and David Leitch and starring Keanu Reeves, Michael Nyqvist, Alfie Allen, Adrianne Palicki, Bridget Moynahan, Dean Winters, Ian McShane, John Leguizamo and Willem Dafoe. The film stars Reeves as John Wick, a retired hitman seeking vengeance for the theft of his vintage car and the killing of his puppy, a gift from his recently deceased wife. Stahelski and Leitch directed the film together, though Leitch was uncredited. A sequel, titled John Wick: Chapter 2, was released on February 10, 2017. Chapter 3 is due in 2019.

dir.title: Child's Play Collection (1988-2017)
dir.summary:
Overview
A horror film series franchise featuring Chucky, a killer Good Guys doll with the soul of a notorious serial killer.

dir.title: Rocky Collection (1976-2018)
dir.summary:
Overview
These sport drama films begin by telling the rags to riches American Dream story of Rocky Balboa, an uneducated but kind-hearted working class Italian-American boxer working as a debt collector for a loan shark in the slums of Philadelphia..

dir.title: Back to the Future Collection (1985-1990)
dir.summary:
Overview
The family friendly action packed, sci-fi Back to the Future movie collection.

dir.title: Star Wars Collection (1977-2019)
dir.summary:
Overview
An epic space opera theatrical film series that depicts the adventures of various characters "a long time ago in a galaxy far, far away".

dir.title: Spider-Man Collection (2002-2007)
dir.summary: The series of Spider-Man films, directed by Sam Raimi, beginning with Spider-Man in 2002. The films are very loosely inspired by the stories from the popular comic book series.

dir.title: The Amazing Spider-Man Collection (2012-2014)
dir.summary:
Overview
A superhero film series based on the Marvel Comics character Spider-Man. It is a reboot of Sony's Spider-Man film franchise.

dir.title: Die Hard Collection (1988-2013)
dir.summary:
Overview
An action film series centered around the character of John McClane, a New York City police detective who finds himself fighting a group of terrorists in each film.

dir.title: Alien Collection (1979-1997)
dir.summary:
Overview
A science fiction horror film franchise, focusing on Lieutenant Ellen Ripley (Sigourney Weaver) and her battle with an extraterrestrial life-form, commonly referred to as "the Alien". Produced by 20th Century Fox, the series started with the 1979 film Alien, then Aliens in 1986, Alien³ in 1992, and Alien: Resurrection in 1997.

dir.title: Home Alone Collection (1990-2012)
dir.summary:
Overview
Home Alone is a 1990 American family comedy film written and produced by John Hughes and directed by Chris Columbus. The film stars Macaulay Culkin as Kevin McCallister, an eight-year-old boy, who is mistakenly left behind when his family flies to Paris for their Christmas vacation. The film was followed by a commercially successful sequel in 1992, Home Alone 2: Lost in New York, which brings back the first film's cast. Home Alone 3, released in 1997, has completely different actors, and a different storyline. A fourth film followed in 2002, Home Alone 4. This film features some of the same characters featured in the first two films, but with a new cast and a storyline that does not fall into the same continuity. On November 25, 2012, a fifth film, Home Alone: The Holiday Heist premiered during ABC Family's 25 Days of Christmas programming event.

dir.title: National Lampoon's Vacation Collection (1983-2015)
dir.summary:
Overview
The collection of movies featuring everyone's favorite family, the Griswold's!

dir.title: Blade Collection (1998-2004)
dir.summary:
Overview
The successful blockbuster vampire series with Wesley Snipes in the lead role.

dir.title: The Terminator Collection (1984-2019)
dir.summary:
Overview
A series of science-fiction films about the futuristic conflict between the humans led by John Connor and the terminators that are made and controlled by Skynet, a self-aware super computer that started Armageddon and may indeed end humanity for good. Skynet's most well-known products in its genocidal goals are the various terminator models, such as the T-800 (Model 101).

dir.title: Star Wars Collection (1977-2019)
dir.summary:
Overview
An epic space opera theatrical film series that depicts the adventures of various characters "a long time ago in a galaxy far, far away"..

dir.title: Jurassic Park Collection (1993-2018)
dir.summary:
Overview
An American science fiction adventure film series based on the novel of the same name by Michael Crichton. The films center on the fictional Isla Nublar near Costa Rica in the Central American Pacific Coast, where a billionaire philanthropist and a small team of genetic scientists have created an amusement park of cloned dinosaurs.

dir.title: X-Men Collection (2000-2018)
dir.summary:
Overview
A superhero film series about a team of mutant superheroes based on the Marvel Comics superheroes of the same name.

dir.title: The Fast and the Furious Collection (2001-2021)
dir.summary:
Overview
An action film series centered on illegal street racing and heists.

dir.title: Thor Collection (2011-2017)
dir.summary:
Overview
A superhero film series based on the comic book character of the same name published by Marvel Comics, and part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) film series. The series centers on Thor, the crown prince of Asgard.

dir.title: Indiana Jones Collection (1981-2020)
dir.summary:
Overview
The Adventure films series from the Director George Lucas and Steven Spielberg, starring Harrison Ford as the archeologist Dr. Henry Walton "Indiana" Jones, Jr..

dir.title: Wrong Turn Collection (2003-2014)
dir.summary:
Overview
Wrong Turn is a series of American horror slasher films created by Alan B. McElroy and Rob Schmidt. The series has grossed over $50 million in worldwide. The first series entry Wrong Turn was released on May 30, 2003. The second entry Wrong Turn 2 Dead End was released on October 9, 2007 followed by a third installment, Wrong Turn 3: Left for Dead, released October 20, 2009. Wrong Turn 4: Bloody Beginnings was released on October 17, 2011. The films follows a group of people fighting for their survival against a family of hideously deformed inbred cannibals who plan to ruthlessly butcher them all.

dir.title: The Jaws Collection (1975-1987)
dir.summary:
Overview
The classic horror films about a great white shark that’s been attacking people of the coast of New England and bringing terror to their beach vacations. The first film was a major box-office success bringing in almost 500 million world wide and spawning the blockbuster movie phenomena and three sequels.

dir.title: The Bourne Collection (2002-2016)
dir.summary:
Overview
Matt Damon is Jason Bourne, an elite government agent determined to outwit and outmaneuver anyone who stands in the way of his finding out the secrets of his mysterious past. Follow his explosive, action-packed adventures in five blockbuster films from one of the most popular series of all time: The Bourne Identity, The Bourne Supremacy, The Bourne Ultimatum, The Bourne Legacy and Jason Bourne.

dir.title: Mission Impossible Collection (1996-2015)
dir.summary:
Overview
Matt Damon is Jason Bourne, an elite government agent determined to outwit and outmaneuver anyone who stands in the way of his finding out the secrets of his mysterious past. Follow his explosive, action-packed adventures in five blockbuster films from one of the most popular series of all time: The Bourne Identity, The Bourne Supremacy, The Bourne Ultimatum, The Bourne Legacy and Jason Bourne.

dir.title: Planet of the Apes (Reboot) Collection (2011-2017)
dir.summary: Overview In 2005, screenwriters Rick Jaffa and Amanda Silver developed a concept for a new Planet of the Apes film, eventually titled Rise of the Planet of the Apes. Inspired by news articles on apes raised as humans and advances in genetics, Jaffa conceived an idea for a film about a genetically enhanced chimp raised in a human household. He and Silver pitched the concept to Fox as a way to reboot the Apes franchise by reinventing the story of the chimpanzee Caesar, the lead character of Conquest. In 2010, producers Peter Chernin and Dylan Clark of Chernin Entertainment stepped in to move the film forward, retaining Jaffa and Silver as writers. Rise was followed the sequel Dawn of the Planet of the Apes in 2014 and Dawn was followed by War for the Planet of the Apes in 2017. In October 2016, it was reported that a fourth Planet of the Apes film was being discussed.

dir.title: Transformers Collection (2007-2019)
dir.summary:
Overview
The Transformers series follows the continuing battle between the Autobots and the Decepticons and ultimately, the triumph of good over evil. This collection includes the Theatrically Released Films of the transformers saga only.

dir.title: Night at the Museum Collection (2006-2014)
dir.summary:
Overview
The series of movies starring Ben Stiller as a night guard of the Museum of Natural History in New York City.

dir.title: The Lord of the Rings Collection (2001-2003)
dir.summary:
Overview
The Lord of the Rings trilogy consists of three epic fantasy films, based on the influential novels written by J. R. R. Tolkien, directed by Peter Jackson.

dir.title: The Hunger Games Collection (2012-2015)
dir.summary:
Overview
A science fiction film series based on the novel of the same name by Suzanne Collins. The film series takes place in a dystopian post-apocalyptic future in the nation of Panem, featuring the protagonist, Katniss Everdeen.

dir.title: Divergent Collection (2014-2016)
dir.summary:
Overview
A series of dystopian science fiction action films based on the Divergent novels by the American author Veronica Roth. Set in a dystopian and post-apocalyptic Chicago where people are divided into distinct factions based on human virtues. Beatrice Prior (Tris) is warned that she is Divergent and thus will never fit into any one of the factions. She along with Tobias Eaton (Four) soon learn that a sinister plot is brewing in the seemingly perfect society.

dir.title: The Twilight Collection (2008-2012)
dir.summary:
Overview
The Twilight movies are a romantic fantasy vampire series based on the series of novels by Stephenie Meyer.

dir.title: Dirty Harry Collection (1971-1988)
dir.summary:
Overview
Dirty Harry is the name of a series of films and novels featuring fictional San Francisco Police Department Homicide Division Inspector "Dirty" Harry Callahan, portrayed by Clint Eastwood. Eastwood's character also helped popularize the .44 Magnum, as Harry Callahan is famously shown wielding his Smith & Wesson Model 29 revolver.
